pullRequest.body:
This PR proves that a transitive permutation group generated by transpositions must be the whole symmetric group.

nodes.body:
Thanks! I tried extracting the lemmas (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10035/commits/47e8fbec44a4f2a7ca1cbb68ed3c6cc523754ee2).

I was able to extract the second fact, but the statement ended up looking awfully clunky and specialized in my eyes, so I don't know if there's much point keeping it as a separate lemma?

The first fact (after adding a symmetry assumption on the generating set) seems tricky to extract since "sending an element of T to an element of O\T" is not quite the same thing as "swapping an element of T with an element of O\T", and going between these would require a bit of case bashing (you would assume sigma = swap x y takes a in T to b not in T, and then show that {x,y}={a,b}).
I'm going to suggest a golf and a helper lemma later tonight.

I think that the following lemma is a nice generalization of your statement:
```lean
open Subgroup MulAction in
theorem mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap [Finite Œ±] {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} {œÉ : Perm Œ±}
    (hS : ‚àÄ œÉ ‚àà S, œÉ.IsSwap) : œÉ ‚àà closure S ‚Üî ‚àÄ x, œÉ x ‚àà orbit (closure S) x := by
  refine ‚ü®fun hœÉ x ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.2 ‚ü®‚ü®œÉ, hœÉ‚ü©, rfl‚ü©, fun hœÉ ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
```
(I only prove the easy implication here).

Unfortunately, I don't see a short proof yet. I'll think about it tomorrow.

> Thanks! I tried extracting the lemmas (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/47e8fbec44a4f2a7ca1cbb68ed3c6cc523754ee2).

Thanks for trying!

> I was able to extract the second fact, but the statement ended up looking awfully clunky and specialized in my eyes, so I don't know if there's much point keeping it as a separate lemma?

I think it's not too clunky and is worthwhile to extract. Using `T.Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà H)` would make it even less clunky, so would removing the unnecessary hypothesis `hb : b ‚àâ T`.
~~And my other statement is probably shorter: if the stabilizer of T is a subset of H, and H includes a transposition (ab) with a in T, then the stabilizer of T ‚à™ {b} is a subset of H. You even added [Equiv.swap_mem_stabilizer](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Basic.html#Equiv.swap_mem_stabilizer) already.~~

> The first fact (after adding a symmetry assumption on the generating set) seems tricky to extract since "sending an element of T to an element of O\T" is not quite the same thing as "swapping an element of T with an element of O\T", and going between these would require a bit of case bashing (you would assume sigma = swap x y takes a in T to b not in T, and then show that {x,y}={a,b}).

The symmetry assumption is unnecessary if T or O\T is finite. And yes we seem to be missing a lemma stating `swap a b = swap x y` iff `{a,b}={x,y}` (if a ‚â† b or if x ‚â† y), even though we have [Set.pair_eq_pair_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Basic.html#Set.pair_eq_pair_iff). I think we should probably add that too!

> ~~And my other statement is probably shorter: if the stabilizer of T is a subset of H, and H includes a transposition (ab) with a in T, then the stabilizer of T ‚à™ {b} is a subset of H.~~

Sorry, I don't know what I was thinking. The correct statement should be: if the [fixingSubgroup](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/FixingSubgroup.html#fixingSubgroup) of T' is a subset of H, and H includes a transposition (ab) with a not in T', then the fixingSubgroup of T'\{b} is a subset of H.

I managed to get a sorry-free proof of @urkud's generalization. I haven't cleaned it up yet, but before I do, I just wanted to check whether either you had ideas for streamlining/shortcutting the proof at all? (for instance, is there an easier way to get something like `exists_list_swap`?)

```
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.Perm.Cycle.Concrete
import Mathlib.Data.List.Card
import Mathlib.Data.List.Indexes

open Equiv List MulAction Pointwise Set Subgroup

variable {Œ± : Type*} [DecidableEq Œ±]

lemma length_remove_le (l : List Œ±) (a : Œ±) :
    (l.remove a).length ‚â§ l.length := by
  induction' l with b l ih
  ¬∑ simp [remove]
  ¬∑ simp [remove]
    split_ifs
    ¬∑ linarith
    ¬∑ simp
      linarith

lemma length_remove_lt_of_mem {l : List Œ±} {a : Œ±} (h : a ‚àà l) :
    (l.remove a).length < l.length := by
  induction' l with b l ih
  ¬∑ contradiction
  ¬∑ rw [mem_cons] at h
    rcases h with rfl | h
    ¬∑ simp [remove]
      have := length_remove_le l a
      linarith
    ¬∑ specialize ih h
      simp [remove]
      split_ifs
      ¬∑ linarith
      ¬∑ simp
        linarith

def swapFactorsAux (l0 : List Œ±) (a : Œ±) (f : Perm Œ±) (hf : ‚àÄ {x}, f x ‚â† x ‚Üí x ‚àà l0) :
    { l : List Œ± // (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f ‚àß f‚Åª¬π a ‚àâ l ‚àß ‚àÄ x ‚àà l, x ‚àà l0 } :=
  if ha0 : f a = a then
    if ha : a ‚àà l0 then
      have : (l0.remove a).length < l0.length := by
        exact length_remove_lt_of_mem ha
      let p := swapFactorsAux (l0.remove a) a f (by
        intro x hx
        rw [mem_remove_iff]
        refine' ‚ü®hf hx, _‚ü©
        rintro rfl
        contradiction)
      ‚ü®p, p.2.1, p.2.2.1, by
        intro x hx
        exact mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 x hx)
        ‚ü©
    else
      match l0 with
      | [] => ‚ü®[], Equiv.ext fun x => by
          rw [map_nil, prod_nil]
          exact (Classical.not_not.1 (mt hf (List.not_mem_nil _))).symm,
        by simp‚ü©
      | x :: l =>
          if hx : f x = x then
            let p := swapFactorsAux l a f (by
              intro y hy
              specialize hf hy
              rw [mem_cons] at hf
              rcases hf with rfl | hf
              ¬∑ contradiction
              ¬∑ exact hf
            )
            ‚ü®p, p.2.1, p.2.2.1, by
              intro x hx
              rw [mem_cons]
              exact Or.inr (p.2.2.2 x hx)
            ‚ü©
          else
            have : (l.remove x).length < (x :: l).length := by
              have := length_remove_le l x
              simp
              linarith
            let p := swapFactorsAux (l.remove x) (f x) (swap x (f x) * f) (by
              intro y hy
              rw [Perm.mul_apply] at hy
              rcases eq_or_ne x y with rfl | h1
              ¬∑ rw [swap_apply_right] at hy
                contradiction
              ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne x (f y) with rfl | h2
                ¬∑ specialize hf h1
                  rw [mem_cons, eq_comm] at hf
                  rcases hf with _ | hf
                  ¬∑ contradiction
                  ¬∑ rw [mem_remove_iff]
                    exact ‚ü®hf, h1.symm‚ü©
                ¬∑ rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne h2.symm] at hy
                  ¬∑ specialize hf hy
                    rw [mem_cons] at hf
                    rcases hf with _ | hf
                    ¬∑ symm at h1
                      contradiction
                    ¬∑ rw [mem_remove_iff]
                      exact ‚ü®hf, h1.symm‚ü©
                  ¬∑ contrapose! h1
                    symm
                    simp only [EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq] at h1
                    exact h1
            )
            ‚ü®x :: p.1, by
              rw [map_cons, prod_cons]
              have key := p.2.1
              rw [‚Üê eq_inv_mul_iff_mul_eq, swap_inv]
              refine' Eq.trans _ key
              apply congrArg
              apply List.map_congr
              intro y hy
              congr 1
              have key' := p.2.2.1
              simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key'
              have : y ‚â† f‚Åª¬π x
              ¬∑ intro h
                rw [h] at hy
                exfalso
                refine' key' hy
              have : f y ‚â† x
              ¬∑ contrapose! this
                exact Perm.eq_inv_iff_eq.mpr this
              rw [Perm.mul_apply]
              have key'' := p.2.2.2 y hy
              rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne this]
              simp only [ne_eq, EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq]
              rintro rfl
              rw [mem_remove_iff] at key''
              apply key''.2
              rfl
              ,
              by
                have key := p.2.2.1
                simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key
                rw [mem_cons, not_or]
                have : f‚Åª¬π a = a
                ¬∑ rw [‚Üê ha0]
                  simp
                  simp [ha0]
                rw [this]
                rw [mem_cons, not_or] at ha
                refine' ‚ü®ha.1, _‚ü©
                intro h
                apply ha.2
                exact mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 a h)
              , by
                  intro y hy
                  rw [mem_cons] at hy ‚ä¢
                  rcases hy with hy | hy
                  ¬∑ exact Or.inl hy
                  ¬∑ exact Or.inr (mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 y hy))‚ü©
  else
    have : (l0.remove a).length < l0.length := by
      exact length_remove_lt_of_mem (hf ha0)
    let p := swapFactorsAux (l0.remove a) (f a) (swap a (f a) * f) (by
      intro x hx
      rw [mem_remove_iff]
      rw [Perm.mul_apply] at hx
      rcases eq_or_ne x a with rfl | h
      ¬∑ rw [swap_apply_right] at hx
        contradiction
      ¬∑ refine' ‚ü®_, h‚ü©
        apply hf
        intro h'
        rw [h'] at hx
        rw [swap_apply_ne_self_iff] at hx
        replace hx := hx.2
        rcases hx with rfl | rfl
        ¬∑ contradiction
        ¬∑ simp only [EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq] at h'
          contradiction
      )
    ‚ü®a :: p.1, by
      have key := p.2.1
      rw [map_cons, prod_cons]
      rw [‚Üê eq_inv_mul_iff_mul_eq, swap_inv]
      refine' Eq.trans _ key
      apply congrArg
      apply List.map_congr
      intro x hx
      congr 1
      have key' := p.2.2.1
      simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key'
      have : x ‚â† f‚Åª¬π a
      ¬∑ intro h
        rw [h] at hx
        exfalso
        refine' key' hx
      have : f x ‚â† a
      ¬∑ contrapose! this
        exact Perm.eq_inv_iff_eq.mpr this
      rw [Perm.mul_apply]
      have key'' := p.2.2.2 x hx
      rw [mem_remove_iff] at key''
      rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne this]
      simp only [ne_eq, EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq]
      exact key''.2,
        by
      have key := p.2.2.1
      simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key
      rw [mem_cons, not_or]
      refine' ‚ü®_, key‚ü©
      intro h
      apply ha0
      exact (eq_symm_apply f).mp (id h.symm), by
        intro x hx
        rw [mem_cons] at hx
        rcases hx with rfl | hx
        ¬∑ exact hf ha0
        ¬∑ exact mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 x hx)
      ‚ü©
termination_by swapFactorsAux l _ _ _ => l.length

def swapFactorsAux' (l0 : List Œ±) (a : Œ±) (f : Perm Œ±) (hf : ‚àÄ {x}, f x ‚â† x ‚Üí x ‚àà l0) :
    { l : List Œ± // (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f } :=
  let h := swapFactorsAux l0 a f hf
  ‚ü®h.1, h.2.1‚ü©

def truncSwapFactors [Fintype Œ±] (f : Perm Œ±) (a : Œ±) :
    Trunc { l : List Œ± // (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f } :=
  Quotient.recOnSubsingleton (@Finset.univ Œ± _).1 (fun l h => Trunc.mk (swapFactorsAux' l a f (h _)))
    (show ‚àÄ x, f x ‚â† x ‚Üí x ‚àà (@Finset.univ Œ± _).1 from fun _ _ => Finset.mem_univ _)

def exists_list_swap [Fintype Œ±] (f : Perm Œ±) :
    ‚àÉ l : List Œ±, (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f := by
  rcases isEmpty_or_nonempty Œ± with h | ‚ü®‚ü®a‚ü©‚ü©
  ¬∑ exact ‚ü®[], Subsingleton.elim _ _‚ü©
  ¬∑ have q := truncSwapFactors f a
    refine' ‚ü®q.out, q.out.2‚ü©

variable [Finite Œ±]

theorem aux2
    {H : Subgroup (Perm Œ±)} {T : Set Œ±} (hT : T.Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà H))
    {a b : Œ±} (ha : a ‚àà T) (hab : swap a b ‚àà H) :
    ({b} ‚à™ T).Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà H) := by
  rintro x (rfl | hx) y (rfl | hy) hxy
  ¬∑ contradiction
  ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne y a with rfl | h
    ¬∑ exact swap_comm x y ‚ñ∏ hab
    rw [‚Üê swap_mul_swap_mul_swap h hxy.symm]
    exact H.mul_mem (H.mul_mem hab (hT hy ha h)) hab
  ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne x a with rfl | h
    ¬∑ exact swap_comm x y ‚ñ∏ hab
    rw [swap_comm, ‚Üê swap_mul_swap_mul_swap h hxy]
    exact H.mul_mem (H.mul_mem hab (hT hx ha h)) hab
  ¬∑ exact hT hx hy hxy

lemma orbit_lemma {G : Type*} [Group G] {Œ± : Type*} [MulAction G Œ±] {a b c : Œ±} (h1 : a ‚àà orbit G c) :
    b ‚àà orbit G c ‚Üî b ‚àà orbit G a := by
  simp only [‚Üê orbit_eq_iff] at h1 ‚ä¢
  rw [h1]

theorem swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {x y : Œ±} : swap x y ‚àà closure S ‚Üî x ‚àà orbit (closure S) y := by
  refine ‚ü®fun h ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®swap x y, h‚ü©, swap_apply_right x y‚ü©, fun hf ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
  let P : Set Œ± ‚Üí Prop := fun T ‚Ü¶ T.Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà closure S)
  suffices : P (orbit (closure S) y)
  ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne x y with rfl | hxy
    ¬∑ rw [swap_self]
      apply one_mem
    ¬∑ exact this hf (mem_orbit_self y) hxy
  refine' (toFinite _).induction_to ‚àÖ (empty_subset _) (pairwise_empty _) (fun T hT ih ‚Ü¶ _)
  rcases T.eq_empty_or_nonempty with rfl | hT'
  ¬∑ exact ‚ü®y, by simp‚ü©
  have key0 : ¬¨ closure S ‚â§ stabilizer (Perm Œ±) T
  ¬∑ obtain ‚ü®a, haT‚ü© := hT'
    obtain ‚ü®b, hb, hbT‚ü© := exists_of_ssubset hT
    have ha : a ‚àà orbit (closure S) y := hT.1 haT
    obtain ‚ü®‚ü®œÉ, hœÉ‚ü©, rfl‚ü© := (orbit_lemma ha).mp hb
    exact fun h ‚Ü¶ hbT (h hœÉ ‚ñ∏ smul_mem_smul_set haT)
  have key : ‚àÉ a b, swap a b ‚àà S ‚àß a ‚àà T ‚àß b ‚àâ T
  ¬∑ rw [closure_le, not_subset] at key0
    obtain ‚ü®œÑ, hœÑ, hœÑ'‚ü© := key0
    obtain ‚ü®x, y, -, rfl‚ü© := hS œÑ hœÑ
    rw [SetLike.mem_coe, swap_mem_stabilizer, not_iff] at hœÑ'
    by_cases hx : x ‚àà T
    ¬∑ exact ‚ü®x, y, hœÑ, hx, fun hy ‚Ü¶ hœÑ'.mpr hy hx‚ü©
    ¬∑ exact ‚ü®y, x, swap_comm x y ‚ñ∏ hœÑ, hœÑ'.mp hx, hx‚ü©
  obtain ‚ü®a, b, hab, ha, hb‚ü© := key
  refine' ‚ü®b, ‚ü®_, hb‚ü©, aux2 ih ha (subset_closure hab)‚ü©
  exact (orbit_lemma (hT.1 ha)).mpr ‚ü®‚ü®swap a b, subset_closure hab‚ü©, swap_apply_left a b‚ü©

theorem mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {f : Perm Œ±} : f ‚àà closure S ‚Üî ‚àÄ x, f x ‚àà orbit (closure S) x := by
  refine ‚ü®fun hf x ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®f, hf‚ü©, rfl‚ü©, fun hf ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
  have := Fintype.ofFinite Œ±
  obtain ‚ü®l, hl‚ü© := exists_list_swap f
  refine hl ‚ñ∏ list_prod_mem (fun x hx ‚Ü¶ ?_)
  obtain ‚ü®y, -, rfl‚ü© := List.mem_map.mp hx
  rw [swap_comm, swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap hS]
  exact hf y
```

Here is a proof that doesn't use List and also generalizes to action on an infinite type:
```
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Finite
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupAction.Basic
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.Perm.Support

open Equiv List MulAction Pointwise Set Subgroup

variable {G Œ± : Type*} [Group G] [MulAction G Œ±] [DecidableEq Œ±]

lemma orbit_lemma {a b c : Œ±} (h : a ‚àà orbit G c) :
    b ‚àà orbit G c ‚Üî b ‚àà orbit G a := by
  simp only [‚Üê orbit_eq_iff] at h ‚ä¢
  rw [h]

theorem aux1 (S : Set G) (T : Set Œ±) {a : Œ±} (hS : ‚àÄ g ‚àà S, g‚Åª¬π ‚àà S)
    (subset : T ‚äÜ orbit (closure S) a) (not_mem : a ‚àâ T) (nonempty : T.Nonempty) :
    ‚àÉ œÉ ‚àà S, ‚àÉ a ‚àà T, œÉ ‚Ä¢ a ‚àâ T := by
  have key0 : ¬¨ closure S ‚â§ stabilizer G T
  ¬∑ have ‚ü®b, hb‚ü© := nonempty
    obtain ‚ü®œÉ, rfl‚ü© := subset hb
    refine fun h ‚Ü¶ not_mem ?_
    rw [‚Üê h (inv_mem œÉ.2), mem_smul_set]
    exact ‚ü®_, hb, show œÉ‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ œÉ ‚Ä¢ a = _ by simp‚ü©
  contrapose! key0
  refine (closure_le _).mpr fun œÉ hœÉ ‚Ü¶ by_contra fun h ‚Ü¶ ?_
  simp_rw [SetLike.mem_coe, mem_stabilizer_iff, Set.ext_iff, not_forall, mem_smul_set] at h
  obtain ‚ü®a, h‚ü© := h
  exact h ‚ü®fun ‚ü®b, hb, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ h ‚ñ∏ key0 _ hœÉ _ hb, fun h ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, key0 _ (hS œÉ hœÉ) _ h, by simp‚ü©‚ü©

theorem SubmonoidClass.swap_mem_trans {a b c : Œ±} {C} [SetLike C (Perm Œ±)]
    [SubmonoidClass C (Perm Œ±)] (M : C)
    (hab : swap a b ‚àà M) (hbc : swap b c ‚àà M) : swap a c ‚àà M := by
  obtain rfl | hab' := eq_or_ne a b; ¬∑ exact hbc
  obtain rfl | hac := eq_or_ne a c; ¬∑ rw [swap_self]; exact one_mem M
  rw [swap_comm, ‚Üê swap_mul_swap_mul_swap hab' hac]
  exact mul_mem (mul_mem hbc hab) hbc

theorem swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {x y : Œ±} : swap x y ‚àà closure S ‚Üî x ‚àà orbit (closure S) y := by
  refine ‚ü®fun h ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®swap x y, h‚ü©, swap_apply_right x y‚ü©, fun hf ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
  by_contra h
  have := aux1 S {x | swap x y ‚àà closure S} (fun f hf ‚Ü¶ ?_) (fun z hz ‚Ü¶ ?_) h ‚ü®y, ?_‚ü©
  ¬∑ obtain ‚ü®œÉ, hœÉ, a, ha, hœÉa‚ü© := this
    obtain ‚ü®z, w, hzw, rfl‚ü© := hS œÉ hœÉ
    rw [Perm.smul_def] at hœÉa
    have := ne_of_mem_of_not_mem ha hœÉa
    rw [ne_comm, swap_apply_ne_self_iff, and_iff_right hzw] at this
    rw [mem_setOf] at ha hœÉa
    apply hœÉa; clear hœÉa
    obtain rfl | rfl := this
    on_goal 1 => rw [swap_apply_left]; rw [swap_comm] at hœÉ
    on_goal 2 => rw [swap_apply_right]
    all_goals exact SubmonoidClass.swap_mem_trans _ (subset_closure hœÉ) ha
  ¬∑ obtain ‚ü®x, y, -, rfl‚ü© := hS f hf; rwa [swap_inv]
  ¬∑ exact (orbit_lemma hf).mp ‚ü®‚ü®_ ,hz‚ü©, swap_apply_right z y‚ü©
  ¬∑ rw [mem_setOf, swap_self]; exact one_mem _

-- `Equiv.Perm.set_support_mul_subset` etc. could be generalized to MulAction

theorem finite_apply_ne_self_closure_iff {S : Set G} :
    (‚àÄ g ‚àà closure S, {x : Œ± | g ‚Ä¢ x ‚â† x}.Finite) ‚Üî ‚àÄ g ‚àà S, {x : Œ± | g ‚Ä¢ x ‚â† x}.Finite :=
  ‚ü®fun h g hg ‚Ü¶ h g (subset_closure hg), fun h g hg ‚Ü¶ by
    refine closure_induction hg h (by simp) (fun g g' hg hg' ‚Ü¶ (hg.union hg').subset ?_) fun g hg ‚Ü¶ ?_
    ¬∑ simp_rw [Ne, mul_smul, ‚Üê compl_setOf, ‚Üê compl_inter, compl_subset_compl]
      intro a ‚ü®hg, hg'‚ü©; rw [mem_setOf] at hg hg' ‚ä¢; rw [hg', hg]
    ¬∑ convert hg using 1; simp_rw [Ne, inv_smul_eq_iff, eq_comm]‚ü©

theorem finite_swap_apply_ne_self {x y : Œ±} : {a | swap x y a ‚â† a}.Finite :=
  Set.Finite.subset (s := {x, y}) (by simp)
    (by simp_rw [swap_apply_ne_self_iff]; exact fun _ ‚Ü¶ (¬∑.2))

theorem Equiv.Perm.IsSwap.finite_apply_ne_self {œÉ : Perm Œ±} (h : œÉ.IsSwap) :
    {a | œÉ a ‚â† a}.Finite := by
  obtain ‚ü®x, y, -, rfl‚ü© := h; exact finite_swap_apply_ne_self

theorem mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {f : Perm Œ±} : f ‚àà closure S ‚Üî {x | f x ‚â† x}.Finite ‚àß ‚àÄ x, f x ‚àà orbit (closure S) x := by
  refine ‚ü®fun hf ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®?_, fun x ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®f, hf‚ü©, rfl‚ü©‚ü©, ?_‚ü©
  ¬∑ exact finite_apply_ne_self_closure_iff.mpr (fun f hf ‚Ü¶ (hS f hf).finite_apply_ne_self) _ hf
  rintro ‚ü®fin, hf‚ü©
  set supp := {x | f x ‚â† x} with supp_eq
  suffices : {x | f x ‚â† x} ‚äÜ supp ‚Üí f ‚àà closure S
  ¬∑ exact this supp_eq.symm.subset
  clear_value supp; clear supp_eq; revert f
  apply fin.induction_on ..
  ¬∑ rintro f - emp; convert (closure S).one_mem; ext; by_contra h; exact emp h
  rintro a s has - ih f hf supp_subset
  refine (mul_mem_cancel_left ((swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap hS).2 (hf a))).1
    (ih (fun b ‚Ü¶ ?_) fun b hb ‚Ü¶ (supp_subset ?_).resolve_left ?_)
  ¬∑ rw [Perm.mul_apply, orbit_lemma (hf b)]
    by_cases h' : f b = a; ¬∑ rw [h', swap_apply_right]; apply hf
    by_cases h : f b = f a; ¬∑ rw [h, swap_apply_left, ‚Üê orbitRel_apply, Setoid.comm']; apply hf
    rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne h h']; apply mem_orbit_self
  ¬∑ rw [mem_setOf] at hb ‚ä¢; contrapose! hb; rw [Perm.mul_apply, hb]
    obtain rfl | hba := eq_or_ne b a; ¬∑ rwa [swap_apply_right]
    refine swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne ?_ hba
    contrapose! hba; exact f.injective (hb.trans hba)
  ¬∑ rw [mem_setOf] at hb; contrapose! hb; rw [Perm.mul_apply, hb, swap_apply_left]
```

nodes.body:
LGTM but IMO the result could be split into two main facts:
1. if T is a nonempty, proper subset of a G-orbit O, then there exists a generator of G that sends an element of T to an element of O\T.
2. if a subgroup contains all transpositions in T and an arbitrary transposition (ab) for some `a ‚àà T`, then it contains all transpositions in `T ‚à™ {b}`. It might be easier to prove and use that the permutations on `T ‚à™ {b}` is generated by all permutations on `T` together with an arbitrary transposition of the form (ab) with `a ‚àà T`.

Thanks! I tried extracting the lemmas (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10035/commits/47e8fbec44a4f2a7ca1cbb68ed3c6cc523754ee2).

I was able to extract the second fact, but the statement ended up looking awfully clunky and specialized in my eyes, so I don't know if there's much point keeping it as a separate lemma?

The first fact (after adding a symmetry assumption on the generating set) seems tricky to extract since "sending an element of T to an element of O\T" is not quite the same thing as "swapping an element of T with an element of O\T", and going between these would require a bit of case bashing (you would assume sigma = swap x y takes a in T to b not in T, and then show that {x,y}={a,b}).
I'm going to suggest a golf and a helper lemma later tonight.

I think that the following lemma is a nice generalization of your statement:
```lean
open Subgroup MulAction in
theorem mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap [Finite Œ±] {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} {œÉ : Perm Œ±}
    (hS : ‚àÄ œÉ ‚àà S, œÉ.IsSwap) : œÉ ‚àà closure S ‚Üî ‚àÄ x, œÉ x ‚àà orbit (closure S) x := by
  refine ‚ü®fun hœÉ x ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.2 ‚ü®‚ü®œÉ, hœÉ‚ü©, rfl‚ü©, fun hœÉ ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
```
(I only prove the easy implication here).

Unfortunately, I don't see a short proof yet. I'll think about it tomorrow.

> Thanks! I tried extracting the lemmas (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/47e8fbec44a4f2a7ca1cbb68ed3c6cc523754ee2).

Thanks for trying!

> I was able to extract the second fact, but the statement ended up looking awfully clunky and specialized in my eyes, so I don't know if there's much point keeping it as a separate lemma?

I think it's not too clunky and is worthwhile to extract. Using `T.Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà H)` would make it even less clunky, so would removing the unnecessary hypothesis `hb : b ‚àâ T`.
~~And my other statement is probably shorter: if the stabilizer of T is a subset of H, and H includes a transposition (ab) with a in T, then the stabilizer of T ‚à™ {b} is a subset of H. You even added [Equiv.swap_mem_stabilizer](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Basic.html#Equiv.swap_mem_stabilizer) already.~~

> The first fact (after adding a symmetry assumption on the generating set) seems tricky to extract since "sending an element of T to an element of O\T" is not quite the same thing as "swapping an element of T with an element of O\T", and going between these would require a bit of case bashing (you would assume sigma = swap x y takes a in T to b not in T, and then show that {x,y}={a,b}).

The symmetry assumption is unnecessary if T or O\T is finite. And yes we seem to be missing a lemma stating `swap a b = swap x y` iff `{a,b}={x,y}` (if a ‚â† b or if x ‚â† y), even though we have [Set.pair_eq_pair_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Basic.html#Set.pair_eq_pair_iff). I think we should probably add that too!

> ~~And my other statement is probably shorter: if the stabilizer of T is a subset of H, and H includes a transposition (ab) with a in T, then the stabilizer of T ‚à™ {b} is a subset of H.~~

Sorry, I don't know what I was thinking. The correct statement should be: if the [fixingSubgroup](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/FixingSubgroup.html#fixingSubgroup) of T' is a subset of H, and H includes a transposition (ab) with a not in T', then the fixingSubgroup of T'\{b} is a subset of H.

I managed to get a sorry-free proof of @urkud's generalization. I haven't cleaned it up yet, but before I do, I just wanted to check whether either you had ideas for streamlining/shortcutting the proof at all? (for instance, is there an easier way to get something like `exists_list_swap`?)

```
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.Perm.Cycle.Concrete
import Mathlib.Data.List.Card
import Mathlib.Data.List.Indexes

open Equiv List MulAction Pointwise Set Subgroup

variable {Œ± : Type*} [DecidableEq Œ±]

lemma length_remove_le (l : List Œ±) (a : Œ±) :
    (l.remove a).length ‚â§ l.length := by
  induction' l with b l ih
  ¬∑ simp [remove]
  ¬∑ simp [remove]
    split_ifs
    ¬∑ linarith
    ¬∑ simp
      linarith

lemma length_remove_lt_of_mem {l : List Œ±} {a : Œ±} (h : a ‚àà l) :
    (l.remove a).length < l.length := by
  induction' l with b l ih
  ¬∑ contradiction
  ¬∑ rw [mem_cons] at h
    rcases h with rfl | h
    ¬∑ simp [remove]
      have := length_remove_le l a
      linarith
    ¬∑ specialize ih h
      simp [remove]
      split_ifs
      ¬∑ linarith
      ¬∑ simp
        linarith

def swapFactorsAux (l0 : List Œ±) (a : Œ±) (f : Perm Œ±) (hf : ‚àÄ {x}, f x ‚â† x ‚Üí x ‚àà l0) :
    { l : List Œ± // (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f ‚àß f‚Åª¬π a ‚àâ l ‚àß ‚àÄ x ‚àà l, x ‚àà l0 } :=
  if ha0 : f a = a then
    if ha : a ‚àà l0 then
      have : (l0.remove a).length < l0.length := by
        exact length_remove_lt_of_mem ha
      let p := swapFactorsAux (l0.remove a) a f (by
        intro x hx
        rw [mem_remove_iff]
        refine' ‚ü®hf hx, _‚ü©
        rintro rfl
        contradiction)
      ‚ü®p, p.2.1, p.2.2.1, by
        intro x hx
        exact mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 x hx)
        ‚ü©
    else
      match l0 with
      | [] => ‚ü®[], Equiv.ext fun x => by
          rw [map_nil, prod_nil]
          exact (Classical.not_not.1 (mt hf (List.not_mem_nil _))).symm,
        by simp‚ü©
      | x :: l =>
          if hx : f x = x then
            let p := swapFactorsAux l a f (by
              intro y hy
              specialize hf hy
              rw [mem_cons] at hf
              rcases hf with rfl | hf
              ¬∑ contradiction
              ¬∑ exact hf
            )
            ‚ü®p, p.2.1, p.2.2.1, by
              intro x hx
              rw [mem_cons]
              exact Or.inr (p.2.2.2 x hx)
            ‚ü©
          else
            have : (l.remove x).length < (x :: l).length := by
              have := length_remove_le l x
              simp
              linarith
            let p := swapFactorsAux (l.remove x) (f x) (swap x (f x) * f) (by
              intro y hy
              rw [Perm.mul_apply] at hy
              rcases eq_or_ne x y with rfl | h1
              ¬∑ rw [swap_apply_right] at hy
                contradiction
              ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne x (f y) with rfl | h2
                ¬∑ specialize hf h1
                  rw [mem_cons, eq_comm] at hf
                  rcases hf with _ | hf
                  ¬∑ contradiction
                  ¬∑ rw [mem_remove_iff]
                    exact ‚ü®hf, h1.symm‚ü©
                ¬∑ rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne h2.symm] at hy
                  ¬∑ specialize hf hy
                    rw [mem_cons] at hf
                    rcases hf with _ | hf
                    ¬∑ symm at h1
                      contradiction
                    ¬∑ rw [mem_remove_iff]
                      exact ‚ü®hf, h1.symm‚ü©
                  ¬∑ contrapose! h1
                    symm
                    simp only [EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq] at h1
                    exact h1
            )
            ‚ü®x :: p.1, by
              rw [map_cons, prod_cons]
              have key := p.2.1
              rw [‚Üê eq_inv_mul_iff_mul_eq, swap_inv]
              refine' Eq.trans _ key
              apply congrArg
              apply List.map_congr
              intro y hy
              congr 1
              have key' := p.2.2.1
              simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key'
              have : y ‚â† f‚Åª¬π x
              ¬∑ intro h
                rw [h] at hy
                exfalso
                refine' key' hy
              have : f y ‚â† x
              ¬∑ contrapose! this
                exact Perm.eq_inv_iff_eq.mpr this
              rw [Perm.mul_apply]
              have key'' := p.2.2.2 y hy
              rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne this]
              simp only [ne_eq, EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq]
              rintro rfl
              rw [mem_remove_iff] at key''
              apply key''.2
              rfl
              ,
              by
                have key := p.2.2.1
                simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key
                rw [mem_cons, not_or]
                have : f‚Åª¬π a = a
                ¬∑ rw [‚Üê ha0]
                  simp
                  simp [ha0]
                rw [this]
                rw [mem_cons, not_or] at ha
                refine' ‚ü®ha.1, _‚ü©
                intro h
                apply ha.2
                exact mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 a h)
              , by
                  intro y hy
                  rw [mem_cons] at hy ‚ä¢
                  rcases hy with hy | hy
                  ¬∑ exact Or.inl hy
                  ¬∑ exact Or.inr (mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 y hy))‚ü©
  else
    have : (l0.remove a).length < l0.length := by
      exact length_remove_lt_of_mem (hf ha0)
    let p := swapFactorsAux (l0.remove a) (f a) (swap a (f a) * f) (by
      intro x hx
      rw [mem_remove_iff]
      rw [Perm.mul_apply] at hx
      rcases eq_or_ne x a with rfl | h
      ¬∑ rw [swap_apply_right] at hx
        contradiction
      ¬∑ refine' ‚ü®_, h‚ü©
        apply hf
        intro h'
        rw [h'] at hx
        rw [swap_apply_ne_self_iff] at hx
        replace hx := hx.2
        rcases hx with rfl | rfl
        ¬∑ contradiction
        ¬∑ simp only [EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq] at h'
          contradiction
      )
    ‚ü®a :: p.1, by
      have key := p.2.1
      rw [map_cons, prod_cons]
      rw [‚Üê eq_inv_mul_iff_mul_eq, swap_inv]
      refine' Eq.trans _ key
      apply congrArg
      apply List.map_congr
      intro x hx
      congr 1
      have key' := p.2.2.1
      simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key'
      have : x ‚â† f‚Åª¬π a
      ¬∑ intro h
        rw [h] at hx
        exfalso
        refine' key' hx
      have : f x ‚â† a
      ¬∑ contrapose! this
        exact Perm.eq_inv_iff_eq.mpr this
      rw [Perm.mul_apply]
      have key'' := p.2.2.2 x hx
      rw [mem_remove_iff] at key''
      rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne this]
      simp only [ne_eq, EmbeddingLike.apply_eq_iff_eq]
      exact key''.2,
        by
      have key := p.2.2.1
      simp_rw [mul_inv_rev, swap_inv, Perm.mul_apply, swap_apply_right] at key
      rw [mem_cons, not_or]
      refine' ‚ü®_, key‚ü©
      intro h
      apply ha0
      exact (eq_symm_apply f).mp (id h.symm), by
        intro x hx
        rw [mem_cons] at hx
        rcases hx with rfl | hx
        ¬∑ exact hf ha0
        ¬∑ exact mem_of_mem_remove (p.2.2.2 x hx)
      ‚ü©
termination_by swapFactorsAux l _ _ _ => l.length

def swapFactorsAux' (l0 : List Œ±) (a : Œ±) (f : Perm Œ±) (hf : ‚àÄ {x}, f x ‚â† x ‚Üí x ‚àà l0) :
    { l : List Œ± // (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f } :=
  let h := swapFactorsAux l0 a f hf
  ‚ü®h.1, h.2.1‚ü©

def truncSwapFactors [Fintype Œ±] (f : Perm Œ±) (a : Œ±) :
    Trunc { l : List Œ± // (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f } :=
  Quotient.recOnSubsingleton (@Finset.univ Œ± _).1 (fun l h => Trunc.mk (swapFactorsAux' l a f (h _)))
    (show ‚àÄ x, f x ‚â† x ‚Üí x ‚àà (@Finset.univ Œ± _).1 from fun _ _ => Finset.mem_univ _)

def exists_list_swap [Fintype Œ±] (f : Perm Œ±) :
    ‚àÉ l : List Œ±, (l.map (fun x ‚Ü¶ swap x (f x))).prod = f := by
  rcases isEmpty_or_nonempty Œ± with h | ‚ü®‚ü®a‚ü©‚ü©
  ¬∑ exact ‚ü®[], Subsingleton.elim _ _‚ü©
  ¬∑ have q := truncSwapFactors f a
    refine' ‚ü®q.out, q.out.2‚ü©

variable [Finite Œ±]

theorem aux2
    {H : Subgroup (Perm Œ±)} {T : Set Œ±} (hT : T.Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà H))
    {a b : Œ±} (ha : a ‚àà T) (hab : swap a b ‚àà H) :
    ({b} ‚à™ T).Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà H) := by
  rintro x (rfl | hx) y (rfl | hy) hxy
  ¬∑ contradiction
  ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne y a with rfl | h
    ¬∑ exact swap_comm x y ‚ñ∏ hab
    rw [‚Üê swap_mul_swap_mul_swap h hxy.symm]
    exact H.mul_mem (H.mul_mem hab (hT hy ha h)) hab
  ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne x a with rfl | h
    ¬∑ exact swap_comm x y ‚ñ∏ hab
    rw [swap_comm, ‚Üê swap_mul_swap_mul_swap h hxy]
    exact H.mul_mem (H.mul_mem hab (hT hx ha h)) hab
  ¬∑ exact hT hx hy hxy

lemma orbit_lemma {G : Type*} [Group G] {Œ± : Type*} [MulAction G Œ±] {a b c : Œ±} (h1 : a ‚àà orbit G c) :
    b ‚àà orbit G c ‚Üî b ‚àà orbit G a := by
  simp only [‚Üê orbit_eq_iff] at h1 ‚ä¢
  rw [h1]

theorem swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {x y : Œ±} : swap x y ‚àà closure S ‚Üî x ‚àà orbit (closure S) y := by
  refine ‚ü®fun h ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®swap x y, h‚ü©, swap_apply_right x y‚ü©, fun hf ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
  let P : Set Œ± ‚Üí Prop := fun T ‚Ü¶ T.Pairwise (swap ¬∑ ¬∑ ‚àà closure S)
  suffices : P (orbit (closure S) y)
  ¬∑ rcases eq_or_ne x y with rfl | hxy
    ¬∑ rw [swap_self]
      apply one_mem
    ¬∑ exact this hf (mem_orbit_self y) hxy
  refine' (toFinite _).induction_to ‚àÖ (empty_subset _) (pairwise_empty _) (fun T hT ih ‚Ü¶ _)
  rcases T.eq_empty_or_nonempty with rfl | hT'
  ¬∑ exact ‚ü®y, by simp‚ü©
  have key0 : ¬¨ closure S ‚â§ stabilizer (Perm Œ±) T
  ¬∑ obtain ‚ü®a, haT‚ü© := hT'
    obtain ‚ü®b, hb, hbT‚ü© := exists_of_ssubset hT
    have ha : a ‚àà orbit (closure S) y := hT.1 haT
    obtain ‚ü®‚ü®œÉ, hœÉ‚ü©, rfl‚ü© := (orbit_lemma ha).mp hb
    exact fun h ‚Ü¶ hbT (h hœÉ ‚ñ∏ smul_mem_smul_set haT)
  have key : ‚àÉ a b, swap a b ‚àà S ‚àß a ‚àà T ‚àß b ‚àâ T
  ¬∑ rw [closure_le, not_subset] at key0
    obtain ‚ü®œÑ, hœÑ, hœÑ'‚ü© := key0
    obtain ‚ü®x, y, -, rfl‚ü© := hS œÑ hœÑ
    rw [SetLike.mem_coe, swap_mem_stabilizer, not_iff] at hœÑ'
    by_cases hx : x ‚àà T
    ¬∑ exact ‚ü®x, y, hœÑ, hx, fun hy ‚Ü¶ hœÑ'.mpr hy hx‚ü©
    ¬∑ exact ‚ü®y, x, swap_comm x y ‚ñ∏ hœÑ, hœÑ'.mp hx, hx‚ü©
  obtain ‚ü®a, b, hab, ha, hb‚ü© := key
  refine' ‚ü®b, ‚ü®_, hb‚ü©, aux2 ih ha (subset_closure hab)‚ü©
  exact (orbit_lemma (hT.1 ha)).mpr ‚ü®‚ü®swap a b, subset_closure hab‚ü©, swap_apply_left a b‚ü©

theorem mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {f : Perm Œ±} : f ‚àà closure S ‚Üî ‚àÄ x, f x ‚àà orbit (closure S) x := by
  refine ‚ü®fun hf x ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®f, hf‚ü©, rfl‚ü©, fun hf ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
  have := Fintype.ofFinite Œ±
  obtain ‚ü®l, hl‚ü© := exists_list_swap f
  refine hl ‚ñ∏ list_prod_mem (fun x hx ‚Ü¶ ?_)
  obtain ‚ü®y, -, rfl‚ü© := List.mem_map.mp hx
  rw [swap_comm, swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap hS]
  exact hf y
```

Here is a proof that doesn't use List and also generalizes to action on an infinite type:
```
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Finite
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupAction.Basic
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.Perm.Support

open Equiv List MulAction Pointwise Set Subgroup

variable {G Œ± : Type*} [Group G] [MulAction G Œ±] [DecidableEq Œ±]

lemma orbit_lemma {a b c : Œ±} (h : a ‚àà orbit G c) :
    b ‚àà orbit G c ‚Üî b ‚àà orbit G a := by
  simp only [‚Üê orbit_eq_iff] at h ‚ä¢
  rw [h]

theorem aux1 (S : Set G) (T : Set Œ±) {a : Œ±} (hS : ‚àÄ g ‚àà S, g‚Åª¬π ‚àà S)
    (subset : T ‚äÜ orbit (closure S) a) (not_mem : a ‚àâ T) (nonempty : T.Nonempty) :
    ‚àÉ œÉ ‚àà S, ‚àÉ a ‚àà T, œÉ ‚Ä¢ a ‚àâ T := by
  have key0 : ¬¨ closure S ‚â§ stabilizer G T
  ¬∑ have ‚ü®b, hb‚ü© := nonempty
    obtain ‚ü®œÉ, rfl‚ü© := subset hb
    refine fun h ‚Ü¶ not_mem ?_
    rw [‚Üê h (inv_mem œÉ.2), mem_smul_set]
    exact ‚ü®_, hb, show œÉ‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ œÉ ‚Ä¢ a = _ by simp‚ü©
  contrapose! key0
  refine (closure_le _).mpr fun œÉ hœÉ ‚Ü¶ by_contra fun h ‚Ü¶ ?_
  simp_rw [SetLike.mem_coe, mem_stabilizer_iff, Set.ext_iff, not_forall, mem_smul_set] at h
  obtain ‚ü®a, h‚ü© := h
  exact h ‚ü®fun ‚ü®b, hb, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ h ‚ñ∏ key0 _ hœÉ _ hb, fun h ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, key0 _ (hS œÉ hœÉ) _ h, by simp‚ü©‚ü©

theorem SubmonoidClass.swap_mem_trans {a b c : Œ±} {C} [SetLike C (Perm Œ±)]
    [SubmonoidClass C (Perm Œ±)] (M : C)
    (hab : swap a b ‚àà M) (hbc : swap b c ‚àà M) : swap a c ‚àà M := by
  obtain rfl | hab' := eq_or_ne a b; ¬∑ exact hbc
  obtain rfl | hac := eq_or_ne a c; ¬∑ rw [swap_self]; exact one_mem M
  rw [swap_comm, ‚Üê swap_mul_swap_mul_swap hab' hac]
  exact mul_mem (mul_mem hbc hab) hbc

theorem swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {x y : Œ±} : swap x y ‚àà closure S ‚Üî x ‚àà orbit (closure S) y := by
  refine ‚ü®fun h ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®swap x y, h‚ü©, swap_apply_right x y‚ü©, fun hf ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
  by_contra h
  have := aux1 S {x | swap x y ‚àà closure S} (fun f hf ‚Ü¶ ?_) (fun z hz ‚Ü¶ ?_) h ‚ü®y, ?_‚ü©
  ¬∑ obtain ‚ü®œÉ, hœÉ, a, ha, hœÉa‚ü© := this
    obtain ‚ü®z, w, hzw, rfl‚ü© := hS œÉ hœÉ
    rw [Perm.smul_def] at hœÉa
    have := ne_of_mem_of_not_mem ha hœÉa
    rw [ne_comm, swap_apply_ne_self_iff, and_iff_right hzw] at this
    rw [mem_setOf] at ha hœÉa
    apply hœÉa; clear hœÉa
    obtain rfl | rfl := this
    on_goal 1 => rw [swap_apply_left]; rw [swap_comm] at hœÉ
    on_goal 2 => rw [swap_apply_right]
    all_goals exact SubmonoidClass.swap_mem_trans _ (subset_closure hœÉ) ha
  ¬∑ obtain ‚ü®x, y, -, rfl‚ü© := hS f hf; rwa [swap_inv]
  ¬∑ exact (orbit_lemma hf).mp ‚ü®‚ü®_ ,hz‚ü©, swap_apply_right z y‚ü©
  ¬∑ rw [mem_setOf, swap_self]; exact one_mem _

-- `Equiv.Perm.set_support_mul_subset` etc. could be generalized to MulAction

theorem finite_apply_ne_self_closure_iff {S : Set G} :
    (‚àÄ g ‚àà closure S, {x : Œ± | g ‚Ä¢ x ‚â† x}.Finite) ‚Üî ‚àÄ g ‚àà S, {x : Œ± | g ‚Ä¢ x ‚â† x}.Finite :=
  ‚ü®fun h g hg ‚Ü¶ h g (subset_closure hg), fun h g hg ‚Ü¶ by
    refine closure_induction hg h (by simp) (fun g g' hg hg' ‚Ü¶ (hg.union hg').subset ?_) fun g hg ‚Ü¶ ?_
    ¬∑ simp_rw [Ne, mul_smul, ‚Üê compl_setOf, ‚Üê compl_inter, compl_subset_compl]
      intro a ‚ü®hg, hg'‚ü©; rw [mem_setOf] at hg hg' ‚ä¢; rw [hg', hg]
    ¬∑ convert hg using 1; simp_rw [Ne, inv_smul_eq_iff, eq_comm]‚ü©

theorem finite_swap_apply_ne_self {x y : Œ±} : {a | swap x y a ‚â† a}.Finite :=
  Set.Finite.subset (s := {x, y}) (by simp)
    (by simp_rw [swap_apply_ne_self_iff]; exact fun _ ‚Ü¶ (¬∑.2))

theorem Equiv.Perm.IsSwap.finite_apply_ne_self {œÉ : Perm Œ±} (h : œÉ.IsSwap) :
    {a | œÉ a ‚â† a}.Finite := by
  obtain ‚ü®x, y, -, rfl‚ü© := h; exact finite_swap_apply_ne_self

theorem mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap {S : Set (Perm Œ±)} (hS : ‚àÄ f ‚àà S, f.IsSwap)
    {f : Perm Œ±} : f ‚àà closure S ‚Üî {x | f x ‚â† x}.Finite ‚àß ‚àÄ x, f x ‚àà orbit (closure S) x := by
  refine ‚ü®fun hf ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®?_, fun x ‚Ü¶ mem_orbit_iff.mpr ‚ü®‚ü®f, hf‚ü©, rfl‚ü©‚ü©, ?_‚ü©
  ¬∑ exact finite_apply_ne_self_closure_iff.mpr (fun f hf ‚Ü¶ (hS f hf).finite_apply_ne_self) _ hf
  rintro ‚ü®fin, hf‚ü©
  set supp := {x | f x ‚â† x} with supp_eq
  suffices : {x | f x ‚â† x} ‚äÜ supp ‚Üí f ‚àà closure S
  ¬∑ exact this supp_eq.symm.subset
  clear_value supp; clear supp_eq; revert f
  apply fin.induction_on ..
  ¬∑ rintro f - emp; convert (closure S).one_mem; ext; by_contra h; exact emp h
  rintro a s has - ih f hf supp_subset
  refine (mul_mem_cancel_left ((swap_mem_closure_iff_mem_orbit_of_isSwap hS).2 (hf a))).1
    (ih (fun b ‚Ü¶ ?_) fun b hb ‚Ü¶ (supp_subset ?_).resolve_left ?_)
  ¬∑ rw [Perm.mul_apply, orbit_lemma (hf b)]
    by_cases h' : f b = a; ¬∑ rw [h', swap_apply_right]; apply hf
    by_cases h : f b = f a; ¬∑ rw [h, swap_apply_left, ‚Üê orbitRel_apply, Setoid.comm']; apply hf
    rw [swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne h h']; apply mem_orbit_self
  ¬∑ rw [mem_setOf] at hb ‚ä¢; contrapose! hb; rw [Perm.mul_apply, hb]
    obtain rfl | hba := eq_or_ne b a; ¬∑ rwa [swap_apply_right]
    refine swap_apply_of_ne_of_ne ?_ hba
    contrapose! hba; exact f.injective (hb.trans hba)
  ¬∑ rw [mem_setOf] at hb; contrapose! hb; rw [Perm.mul_apply, hb, swap_apply_left]
```
This looks wonderful, thanks so much both of you!
I left some lemmas involving `closure`, `fixedBy`, `swap`, `finite` in this file since they probably don't fit anywhere earlier in mathlib, but correct me if I'm wrong.
@urkud Does this look good to you now? If so it would be natural that you merge it; I wrote most of the final version so I'm not sure whether I'm supposed to call maintainer mergee.
